entry.def: An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.

example.ex: I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden...
example.tran: 我时常愉快地回想起几年前在科文特花园的一个时刻。

example.ex: Mr Davis has been asked on a number of occasions.
example.tran: 戴维斯先生曾多次被问及。

entry.def: An occasion is an important event, ceremony, or celebration.

example.ex: Taking her with me on official occasions has been a challenge...
example.tran: 带着她出席正式场合对我来说一直是个挑战。

example.ex: It will be a unique family occasion.
example.tran: 这将是一次特别的家庭聚会。

entry.def: An occasion for doing something is an opportunity for doing it.

example.ex: It is an occasion for all the family to celebrate...
example.tran: 这是个值得举家庆祝的时刻。

example.ex: It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.
example.tran: 这历来都是阐明政府政策的重要时机。

entry.def: To occasion something means to cause it.

example.ex: He argued that the release of hostages should not occasion a change in policy.
example.tran: 他认为释放人质不应造成政策的改变。

entry.def: If you have occasion to do something, it is necessary for you to do it.

example.ex: We have had occasion to deal with members of the group on a variety of charges.
example.tran: 我们有必要以多项罪名起诉该组织的成员。

entry.def: If something happens on occasion, it happens sometimes, but not very often.

example.ex: He treated them seriously and, on occasion, entertained them hilariously...
example.tran: 他对待他们严肃认真，偶尔又逗得他们捧腹不已。

example.ex: He translated not only from the French but also, on occasion, from the Polish.
example.tran: 他不仅做法文翻译，有时也做些波兰语翻译。

entry.tran: 成功应付困难局面；关键时刻发挥作用
entry.def: If you say that someone rose to the occasion, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation.

example.ex: Inverness, however, rose to the occasion in the second half, producing some of the best football they have played for some time.
example.tran: 然而，因弗内斯队在下半场经受住了考验，踢出了很长一段时间以来的最佳水平。
